data.title: Japanese Shipping Companies Halt Operations Amid Persian Gulf Conflict
data.description: Japanese shipping companies have ceased their operations in the Persian Gulf due to the intensifying military conflict in Iran. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the growing concerns over safety and security in the region. The decision comes as tensions continue to rise, impacting global shipping routes and trade. The suspension reflects the broader uncertainty affecting international maritime activities in the area.

data.title: Brent Crude Oil Prices Could Surge Amid Iran Conflict, Warns Economist
data.description:
Brent crude oil prices may rise to approximately $80 per barrel even if the Iran conflict is controlled, according to William Jackson, Chief Emerging Markets Economist at Capital Economics. According to Jin10, this price level was the peak during the 12-day conflict in Iran last June. Jackson cautioned that if the conflict continues to affect supply, oil prices could jump to around $100 per barrel, potentially increasing global inflation rates by 0.6 to 0.7 percentage points.

In a 'doomsday scenario,' where the Strait of Hormuz is completely blocked for 2–4 weeks due to an escalation in conflict, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan have set a target price of $150–200 per barrel. This could trigger a global energy crisis, leading major economies into stagflation or recession. Historically, the second oil crisis in the late 1970s caused international oil prices to soar by over 200%, resulting in a recession in the United States.

data.title: Kalshi CEO: Opposes profiting from individual deaths; will refund fees related to the "whether Khamenei will step down" market.
data.description: In a post on X, Kalshi CEO Tarek Mansour addressed the death of Khamenei and related prediction market events, stating, "We do not list markets directly linked to death. When a market is likely to result in death, we design rules to prevent people from profiting from it." Kalshi will handle the following related events concerning Khamenei's resignation as Supreme Leader: 1. All transaction fees in that market will be refunded; 2. If a user opened a position before Khamenei's death, settlement will be based on the price of the last trade before his death; 3. If a user opened a position after Khamenei's death, full compensation will be provided. Tarek Mansour added, "No user will lose a single dollar in this market. We will settle the market based on the last transaction price before Khamenei's death, which was at 1:14 AM Eastern Time today."

data.title: Iran Responds to Reports of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's Death
data.description: Reports of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's death have sparked a range of reactions in Iran. Bloomberg posted on X that the initial response in Tehran was one of celebration. However, Iranian authorities quickly moved to deny the reports, followed by expressions of mourning. The situation remains fluid as the country grapples with the news.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Iran Declares National Mourning After Supreme Leader's Death
data.description: Iran has announced a period of national mourning following the death of its Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. According to Jin10, the Iranian government issued a statement vowing to make those responsible for his death pay a heavy price. The statement declared a 40-day national mourning period and a seven-day shutdown of public institutions. It expressed deep sorrow over Khamenei's death, which it attributed to an attack by the United States and Israel, labeling it a heinous crime that will be severely punished. The statement emphasized Iran's determination to hold the perpetrators accountable and called for national unity to overcome the crisis.

data.title: USDC Circulation Increases by 1.3 Billion in One Week
data.description: Circle's website reports that during the week ending February 26, approximately 5.3 billion USDC were issued and around 4 billion were redeemed, resulting in a net increase of about 1.3 billion USDC in circulation. According to Foresight News, as of February 26, the total circulation of USDC stands at approximately 75.2 billion, with reserve assets valued at around 75.5 billion USD.

data.title: Iran's Leadership Transition Plan Following Supreme Leader's Passing
data.description: Iranian media reported on March 1 that following the passing of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, the country will be led by President Ebrahim Raisi, the Chief Justice, and a jurist from the Guardian Council. According to Jin10, this leadership structure is part of a transitional plan to ensure stability in the nation. The report highlights the importance of maintaining governance continuity in the wake of such a significant change in leadership. The Guardian Council, which plays a crucial role in overseeing elections and legislation, will have a representative involved in this interim leadership arrangement. This development underscores the structured approach Iran is taking to manage the potential power vacuum and maintain order during the transition period.

data.title: Analyst Warns of Potential Conflict with Iran and Oil Price Surge
data.description: RBC analyst Helima Croft has highlighted concerns about a potential conflict between the United States and Iran. According to Jin10, regional leaders have cautioned the U.S. about the risks of renewed tensions with Iran, which could lead to a significant increase in oil prices, potentially surpassing $100 per barrel. This development poses a clear risk to the global market, as geopolitical tensions often impact energy prices and economic stability.

data.title: Trump: Resolving the Iran issue through diplomatic means remains feasible, and is "much easier now."
data.description: US President Donald Trump said he believes the US-Israeli attack on Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei was effective and could create opportunities for diplomatic solutions. "Obviously, it's much easier now than it was a day ago," Trump said when asked about the possibility of resolving the crisis diplomatically, "because they were badly beaten." Trump expressed confidence in the current progress. (Jin Shi)

data.title: South Korea Plans to Utilize Strategic Oil Reserves in Supply Disruptions
data.description: South Korea's Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy has announced plans to deploy its strategic oil reserves in the event of disruptions in oil supply. According to Jin10, this move is part of the country's broader strategy to ensure energy security amid potential global supply chain challenges. The ministry emphasized the importance of maintaining a stable energy supply to support the nation's economic activities and mitigate the impact of any unforeseen supply interruptions. This strategic approach underscores South Korea's commitment to safeguarding its energy resources and ensuring resilience against external shocks.

data.title: Black Mourning Flags Raised in Iran's Mashhad
data.description: In Iran's second-largest city, Mashhad, black mourning flags have been raised at the Imam Reza shrine. According to Jin10, Mashhad is a significant pilgrimage site for Shia Muslims.

data.title: PRECIOUS METALS | Oil and Precious Metals Contracts See Price Increase
data.description: Oil and precious metals contracts experienced notable price increases yesterday. According to Foresight News, Bloomberg reported that on Hyperliquid, the price of perpetual oil contracts rose by approximately 5% to $70.6 per barrel. Meanwhile, perpetual contracts for gold and silver increased by about 1.3% and 2%, reaching $5,323 per ounce and $94.9 per ounce, respectively.In addition, silver futures led the commodity futures market in trading volume, with transactions exceeding $227 million within 24 hours. Gold futures also saw significant activity, with a trading volume of approximately $173 million.

data.title: Ahmad Vahidi Appointed as New Commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guard
data.description: Ahmad Vahidi has been appointed as the new commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guard. According to Jin10, this leadership change comes amid ongoing geopolitical tensions in the region. Vahidi, who holds the rank of brigadier general, is expected to bring his extensive military experience to the role, potentially influencing Iran's strategic direction. The appointment is seen as a significant move by the Iranian government, reflecting its focus on strengthening military leadership. Observers are closely monitoring how this change might impact Iran's domestic and international policies.

data.title: Vitalik Buterin Highlights AI's Role in Accelerating Ethereum Development
data.description: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin has highlighted the significant impact of artificial intelligence on the development of Ethereum. According to NS3.AI, Buterin pointed out that a developer utilized AI-driven agentic coding to rapidly create a comprehensive Ethereum client prototype, aligning with the 2030 roadmap, in just two weeks. He further noted that advancements in AI are anticipated to enhance network security by facilitating increased testing and formal verification.
